column5: Hey folks,  years ago I bought these down in Florida.  They are made of styrofoam (?) and have a lead core. I have found them on BassPro Florida but not so much luck up here.   But before I order some, has anyone seen them up here ? These are great for when casting from shore as they can weigh up to one once.  Cast a mile.  Any info would be appreciated. Regards
The site says they're available at Vaughan Mill, Bud. I dunno.
These are what I am looking for http://www.basspro.com/webapp/wcs/stores/s...1005000_151-5-6  Thanks
Yup... BPS in Vaughan has em.  G
I'll have a peak tomorrow night to confirm if you want Dave?
I would appreciated that Irishfield as when I called up there the staff said they did not.  But who knows how hard he looked. Thanks again.
Okay..will do. Will be in there around 8 tonight.
Well they have every perceivable float known to man kind in there... EXCEPT the one's that you are looking for !
I swore I saw em Wayne when I was there during the Spring Classic....  Ahhh well... I will keep an eye out for them for you.   G
They have some cheap/knock off/offshore foam floats...lead weighted bottom.. plastic peg.. but no slot for quick attachment.
i thought i saw some @ al flaherty's outdoor store you can call them ahead to see if its the exact brand/spec ur looking for...
That musta been what I saw.... thanks for the heads up.  G

Thanks Irishfield, I did see the ones with the collar.  So I will most likley take some orders from freinds and order a bunch from Florida.  I did check flaherty's and they don't either.  Thanks agin. Have a good day
